questions.question_text:
A company just successfully completed a DR test and is ready to shut down its DR site and resume normal operations.
Which of the following actions should the cloud administrator take FIRST?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The failover would have been to the DR site. Now the DR site is being shutdown so a failback would be appropriate.
I think the right answer is D. Perform a failback

choices.A: Identify the resources that are accessible to the affected IAM user
choices.D: Change the affected IAM user's password
choices.C: Notify users that a data breach has occurred

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agreed, the absolute first thing you should do based on this list is change the affected user's password.

discussion.content: I think the correct answer is C. Clustering

choices.D: Use a storage vendor migration appliance

questions.question_text:
A storage array that is used exclusively for datastores is being decommissioned, and a new array has been installed. Now the private cloud administrator needs to migrate the data.
Which of the following migration methods would be the BEST to use?

A systems administrator is building a new virtualization cluster. The cluster consists of five virtual hosts, which each have flash and spinning disks. This storage is shared among all the virtual hosts, where a virtual machine running on one host may store data on another host.
This is an example of:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
flash(SSD) and spinning(HDD) disks. 

thin-provisioning: you allocate spaces (i.g. 100GB) used only when needed, so I don't reserve the all space if not used.

thick-provisioning: you reserve spaces (i.g. 100GB) independently if you use it or not

hyperconverged storage(HCI): it is used when you share the space of different hosts. You create a virtual pool of storage.

Here we are speaking about hosts, sharing storage.

SAN: here there is no external server storage attached to hosts; storage devices are already inside the hosts.

NFS: it is about file storage.

Selected Answer: C
Hyperconverged Storage: Hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI) integrates compute, storage, and networking into a single system.
